verbose_text: Based on evidence from patient database analysis the Third International Consensus Definitions for Sepsis and Septic Shock (Sepsis-3) proposed that the clinical definition of septic shock should include hypotension, the requirement for adequate fluid resuscitation and treatment with vasopressin, and a serum lactate level> 2 mmol/L [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
